title: From Words to Wires: Generating Functioning Electronic Devices from Natural Language Descriptions. (arXiv:2305.14874v2 [cs.CL] UPDATED)
abstract: In this work, we show that contemporary language models have a previously unknown skill -- the capacity for electronic circuit design from high-level textual descriptions, akin to code generation. We introduce two benchmarks: Pins100, assessing model knowledge of electrical components, and Micro25, evaluating a model's capability to design common microcontroller circuits and code in the Arduino ecosystem that involve input, output, sensors, motors, protocols, and logic -- with models such as GPT-4 and Claude-V1 achieving between 60% to 96% Pass@1 on generating full devices. We include six case studies of using language models as a design assistant for moderately complex devices, such as a radiation-powered random number generator, an emoji keyboard, a visible spectrometer, and several assistive devices, while offering a qualitative analysis performance, outlining evaluation challenges, and suggesting areas of development to improve complex circuit design and practical utility. Title: From Words to Wires: Generating Functioning Electronic Devices from Natural Language Descriptions. (arXiv:2305.14874v2 [cs.CL] UPDATED)
Abstract: In this work, we show that contemporary language models have a previously unknown skill -- the capacity for electronic circuit design from high-level textual descriptions, akin to code generation. We introduce two benchmarks: Pins100, assessing model knowledge of electrical components, and Micro25, evaluating a model's capability to design common microcontroller circuits and code in the Arduino ecosystem that involve input, output, sensors, motors, protocols, and logic -- with models such as GPT-4 and Claude-V1 achieving between 60% to 96% Pass@1 on generating full devices. translated_title: 从文本到电路：从自然语言描述生成功能齐备的电子设备
translated_abstract: 在这项工作中，我们展示了当代语言模型具有先前未知的技能，即能够从高级文本描述中进行电路设计，类似于代码生成。我们引入了两个基准：Pins100，评估模型对电子元件的知识；Micro25，评估模型在Arduino生态系统中设计常见的微控制器电路和代码的能力，包括输入、输出、传感器、电机、协议和逻辑。在生成完整设备方面，像GPT-4和Claude-V1这样的模型在Pass@1方面达到了60%到96%的准确率。我们提供了六个案例研究，使用语言模型作为设计助手来设计中等复杂的设备，例如辐射供电的随机数发生器、表情符号键盘、可见光谱仪和几个辅助设备。同时，我们还对性能进行了定性分析，概述了评估挑战，并提出了改进复杂电路设计和实际应用性的发展方向。
tldr: 本研究展示了当代语言模型具有从文本描述中生成电路设计的能力。我们引入了两个基准评估模型对电子元件的知识和在Arduino生态系统中设计微控制器电路和代码的能力。我们提供了六个案例研究，展示了语言模型作为设计助手在中等复杂设备上的应用。该研究为改进复杂电路设计和实际应用性提供了发展方向。
en_tdlr: This study demonstrates the capability of contemporary language models to generate circuit designs from textual descriptions. Two benchmarks are introduced to evaluate the model's knowledge of electrical components and its ability to design microcontroller circuits and code in the Arduino ecosystem. Six case studies showcase the use of language models as design assistants for moderately complex devices. The study provides insights for improving complex circuit design and practical utility.
